data.title: Lil Baby Inks with ICM Partners for Worldwide Representation
data.meta_description: Lil Baby has signed to ICM Partners for worldwide representation. Previously, the agency had represented the rapper internationally. He’ll be represented in all areas by a team of agents led by Yves C. Pierre and Jacqueline Reynolds-Drumm.
data.text:
courtesy ICM Partners – Lil Baby

Lil Baby has signed to ICM Partners for worldwide representation. Previously, the agency had represented the rapper outside of North America. He’ll be represented in all areas by a team of agents led by Yves C. Pierre and Jacqueline Reynolds-Drumm.

Lil Baby’s rise from a life of crime to a rap sensation in less than three years created a global sensation, making him one of the hottest rappers in the game.

Signed to Kevin “Coach K” Lee and Pierre “Pee” Thomas’ Quality Control Music – where his labelmates include Migos and Lil Yachty – through his own Wolfpack Global, Lil Baby’s certified-platinum album, Harder Than Ever, debuted at #3 on the sales charts, holding four spots concurrently on the pop singles chart. He has been awarded one 5x platinum-certified single, two 3x platinum-certified singles, one 2x platinum-certified single, and four RIAA gold-certified singles.

Recent boxoffice history submitted to Pollstar includes selling out House of Blues Boston April 15, with 2,425 tickets sold and $110,422 grossed, Stage AE in Pittsburgh April 5 (2,340, $115,440), and Myth in Saint Paul, Minn., where he sold 1,835 tickets and grossed just under $95,000.

Lil Baby was previously represented by Cara Lewis Group.
